metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1302 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
When an HTTP/2 stream was destroyed after being handled, the Apache HTTP Server prior to version 2.4.30 could have written a NULL pointer potentially to an already freed memory. The memory pools maintained by the server make this vulnerability hard to trigger in usual configurations, the reporter and the team could not reproduce it outside debug builds, so it is classified as low risk.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1302` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-bin - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-data - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
apache2-utils - 2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> artful and older don't enable http2 in the build. this needs to be fixed by backporting the whole http2 module from a more-recent apache2

criterions.comment: apache2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.29-1ubuntu4.4').
